data.title: High performance flow field visualization with high-order access dependencies
data.affiliation: Zhang, J (Corresponding Author), Peking Univ, Minist Educ, Key Lab Machine Percept, Beijing, Peoples R China. Zhang, Jiang; Yuan, Xiaoru, Peking Univ, Minist Educ, Key Lab Machine Percept, Beijing, Peoples R China. Zhang, Jiang; Yuan, Xiaoru, Peking Univ, Sch EECS, Beijing, Peoples R China. Yuan, Xiaoru, Peking Univ, Beijing Engn Technol Res Ctr Virtual Simulat \& Vi, Beijing, Peoples R China. Guo, Hanqi, Argonne Natl Lab, Argonne, IL 60439 USA.
data.abstract: We present a novel model based on high-order access dependencies for high performance pathline computation in flow field. The high-order access dependencies are defined as transition probabilities from one data block to other blocks based on a few historical data accesses. Compared with existing methods which employed first-order access dependencies, our approach takes the advantages of high order access dependencies with higher accuracy and reliability in data access prediction. In our work, high-order access dependencies are calculated by tracing densely-seeded pathlines. The efficiency of our proposed approach is demonstrated through a parallel particle tracing framework with high-order data prefetching. Results show that our method can achieve higher data locality than the first-order access dependencies based method, thereby reducing the I/O requests and improving the efficiency of pathline computation in various applications.
